availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, merchant. Virginia native. Married to Frances "Fannie" Ferguson Jones. Father of Henry Jones, Jr., Fanny Jones, Mary Elizabeth "Bettie" Jones, Josiah F. Jones, and John W. Jones. Merchant in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Montgomery County in 1850. Merchant in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned an additional five enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Merchant in Montgomery County in 1862. Liquor merchant in Montgomery County in 1863.
